get.summary: Available car groups.
get.description:
Car groups to which the user has access.

This is a personalized view and depends on the enabled platforms.

For simulator platforms such as iRacing, this returns all available
car groupss, not just the ones that are owned by the user.

get.summary: Available cars.
get.description:
Cars to which the user has access.

This is a personalized view and depends on the enabled platforms.

For simulator platforms such as iRacing, this returns all available
cars, not just the ones that are owned by the user.

get.summary: Find laps and lap records.
get.description:
Search for laps or lap records.

This method takes a lot of parameters and allows you to find laps or
lap records. To get a good idea at the kind of filtering you can do,
read the [documentation on lap filtering](/docs/usage/filtering) first.

You will always need to supply at least a track, a car or a user.

To map the filtering capabilities of the app on the parameters below,
here's an overview on which parameters are used for each filter in the
app:

 * **Group laps**: `group`
 * **Drivers / teams**: `drivers`, `teams`, `extraDrivers`
 * **Session type**: `sessionTypes`
 * **Setup**: `sessionSetupTypes`
 * **Related data**: `seeTelemetry`, `seeGhostLap`, `seeSetup`
 * **Lap type**: `lapTypes`
 * **Date driven**: `age`, `after`
 * **Lap time**: `minLapTime`, `maxLapTime`
 * **Driver Rating**: `minRating`, `maxRating`
 * **Fuel level**: `minFuel`, `maxFuel`, `minFuelUsed`, `maxFuelUsed`
 * **Track conditions**: `minConditionsTrackUsage`, `maxConditionsTrackUsage`, `minConditionsTrackWetness`, `maxConditionsTrackWetness`, `minConditionsTrackTemp`, `maxConditionsTrackTemp`, `minConditionsAirTemp`, `maxConditionsAirTemp`, `minConditionsWindVel`, `maxConditionsWindVel`, `minConditionsRelativeHumidity`, `maxConditionsRelativeHumidity`, `minConditionsFogLevel`, `maxConditionsFogLevel`, `minConditionsPrecipitation`, `maxConditionsPrecipitation`, `minConditionsCloud`, `maxConditionsCloud`, `conditionsWindDir`

## Limitations

This method only returns laps driven yourself or your team mates. Use
the relevant parameters to choose the desired selection of laps. For
privacy reasons, no global lap search is available.

Data returned adheres to the defined privacy settings and is thus
specific to the user linked to the API token.

parameters.name: cars
parameters.description:
Car IDs to search for.

This can be a combination of car and car category IDs, where the
car category IDs are supplied as negative number.

For instance, to search for car 3 or category 4, use `cars=3,-4`.

parameters.name: seasons
parameters.description:
Season IDs to search for.

Seasons (and their IDs) can be found in the [platforms](/developer/endpoints/v1/findPlatforms).

parameters.name: drivers
parameters.description:
Drivers to include.

Available values:

  * `me`: Laps driven yourself
  * `following`: Laps by drivers you're following

The drivers selected by this parameter are combined with those from
the `teams` and `extraDrivers` parameters. If none of these
parameters are given, yourself and all teammates will be selected.

parameters.name: teams
parameters.description:
Teams to include (by team slug).

Teammates from the given teams will be included in the results.

The drivers selected by this parameter are combined with those from
the `drivers` and `extraDrivers` parameters. If none of these
parameters are given, yourself and all teammates will be selected.

parameters.name: extraDrivers
parameters.description:
Extra drivers to include (by user slug).

The drivers selected by this parameter are combined with those from
the `drivers` and `teams` parameters. If none of these
parameters are given, yourself and all teammates will be selected.

parameters.name: age
parameters.description:
Maximum lap age.

Any positive number represents the maximum number of days
ago (e.g. `7` would restrict the search to all laps driven
in the past week).

A negative value is interpretered as follows:

  * `-1`: Current season
  * `-2`: Current and previous season
  * `-3`: Last 3 seasons
  * `-4`: Last 4 seasons

parameters.name: sessionTypes
parameters.description:
Filter by session type (default = all).

Available values:

  * `1`: Practice
  * `2`: Qualifying
  * `3`: Race

parameters.name: sessionSetupTypes
parameters.description:
Filter by session setup type (default = all).

Available values:

  * `1`: Open setup
  * `2`: Fixed setup

parameters.name: seeTelemetry
parameters.description:
Require the telemetry of each lap to be visible.

Requires the calling user to have a Pro plan.

parameters.name: seeGhostLap
parameters.description:
Require the ghost lap of each lap to be visible.

Only selects laps that have a ghost lap available.

Requires the calling user to have a Pro plan.

parameters.name: seeSetup
parameters.description:
Require the setup of each lap to be visible.

Only selects laps that have a setup available.

Requires the calling user to have a Pro plan.

parameters.name: lapTypes
parameters.description:
Filter by lap type (default = normal laps only).

Available values:

  * `1`: Normal (full) laps
  * `2`: Joker laps
  * `3`: Out laps (exiting the pitlane)
  * `4`: In laps (entering the pitlane)

parameters.name: unclean
parameters.description: Allow returning unclean (and potentially incomplete) laps.

parameters.name: minRating
parameters.description: Minimum driver rating (e.g. iRating for iRacing).

parameters.name: maxRating
parameters.description: Maximum driver rating (e.g. iRating for iRacing).

parameters.name: minConditionsTrackUsage
parameters.description: Minimum track usage, as a percentage (0 = clean track, 100 = fully rubbered in).

parameters.name: maxConditionsTrackUsage
parameters.description: Maximum track usage, as a percentage (0 = clean track, 100 = fully rubbered in).

parameters.name: minConditionsTrackWetness
parameters.description: Minimum track wetness, as a percentage (0 = dry, 100 = fully wet).

parameters.name: maxConditionsTrackWetness
parameters.description: Maximum track wetness, as a percentage (0 = dry, 100 = fully wet).

parameters.name: minConditionsCloud
parameters.description:
Minimum cloud cover.

Available values:

  * `1`: Clear skies
  * `2`: Partly cloudy
  * `3`: Mostly cloudy
  * `4`: Overcast

parameters.name: maxConditionsCloud
parameters.description:
Maximum cloud cover.

Available values:

  * `1`: Clear skies
  * `2`: Partly cloudy
  * `3`: Mostly cloudy
  * `4`: Overcast

parameters.name: conditionsWindDir
parameters.description:
Allowed wind directions.

Available values:

  * `1`: North
  * `2`: East
  * `3`: South
  * `4`: West

parameters.name: round
parameters.description:
Correct parameters for rounding.

When using the web app, lap searches are adjusted slightly to
compensate for the fact that values are rounded for display. Supply
the desired display units to apply rounding correction on your lap
search.

Available values: `metric`, `englishStandard`.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description:
Grouping of results, determines which laps will be returned (default: `driver`).

Available values:

  * `driver`: Personal best laps per driver.
  * `driver-car`: Personal best laps per driver/car combination.
  * `none`: Return all laps.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit results to the given amount of laps (maximum and default is 1000).

get.summary: Get information about a specific lap.
get.description:
Returns all info about a specific lap.

## Limitations

This method only returns laps driven yourself or your team mates.

Data returned adheres to the defined privacy settings and is thus
specific to the user linked to the API token.

get.summary: Export the telemetry for a lap as a CSV file.
get.description:
Returns a CSV file with the telemetry for the requested lap (if available).

## Limitations

This method only returns laps driven yourself or your team mates.

Data returned adheres to the defined privacy settings and is thus
specific to the user linked to the API token.

get.summary: Information about the currently authenticated user.
get.description: Returns information about the currently authenticated user.

get.summary: Get linked accounts for the current user.
get.description:
Linked accounts such as the iRacing account.

Returns the driver ratings for each attached account, optionally
with their history.

post.summary: Subscribe user to a data pack group.
post.description: Subscribes a user to the given data pack group.

requestBody.description: Data pack group to subscribe to

delete.summary: Unsubscribe user from a data pack group.
delete.description: Unsubscribes a user from the given data pack group.

post.summary: Subscribe user to a data pack.
post.description: Subscribes a user to the given data pack.

delete.summary: Unsubscribe user from a data pack.
delete.description: Unsubscribes a user from the given data pack.

get.summary: Get personal driving statistics.
get.description:
Driving statistics for the authenticated user.

Each returned record is a combination of car, track and day.
You'll need to sum up these rows according to the specific numbers you
want to calculate (e.g. per car).

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Select statistics starting at this date.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Select statistics ending at this date.

parameters.name: cars
parameters.description:
Car IDs to search for.

This can be a combination of car and car category IDs, where the
car category IDs are supplied as negative number.

For instance, to search for car 3 or category 4, use `cars=3,-4`.

get.summary: Available platforms.
get.description:
All data is linked to a platform, which can either be a simulator
platform (such as [iRacing](https://www.iracing.com/)) or the real
world (identified by `-`).

Only platforms to which the user has access are returned.

get.summary: Joined teams.
get.description: Teams that the authenticated user is part of.

get.summary: Get information about a specific team.
get.description:
Returns information about a team.

## Limitations

This method only returns information about teams that the authenticated
user is a member of.

The member list of a team might not be included if the authenticated
user is not a team owner and the team is configured to only show the
member list to team owners.

get.summary: Get data pack groups for a team.
get.description: Gets a list of the data pack groups defined for a team.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit results to the given amount of data pack groups (maximum and default is 1000).

get.summary: Get data pack group for a team.
get.description:
Gets a single data pack group.

Does not include archived data packs, unless the app also has the `team_datapacks_archived_read` permission.

post.summary: Add data pack to a data pack group.
post.description: Adds a data pack to the given data pack group.

delete.summary: Remove data pack from a data pack group.
delete.description: Removes a data pack from the given data pack group.

get.summary: Get data packs for a team.
get.description:
Gets a list of the data packs defined for a team.

Does not include archived data packs, unless the app also has the `team_datapacks_archived_read` permission.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit results to the given amount of data packs (maximum and default is 1000).

get.summary: Get data pack for a team.
get.description: Gets a single data pack.

post.summary: Update data pack for a team.

get.summary: Download ghost lap file for a content item.
get.description:
Downloads the ghost file (if available).

Only applicable to content items with `type == "ghost_lap"` or `type == "lap"`.

For content items with `type == "lap"`, you'll need to have telemetry
viewing permissions to be able to load the ghost lap. See the
`canViewTelemetry` field on `Lap`. Also pay attention to the
`ghostAvailable` field: not every lap has a ghost file available for
download.

get.summary: Export telemetry for a lap content item.
get.description:
Returns a CSV file with the telemetry for the requested lap (if available).

Only applicable to content items with `type == "lap"`.

get.summary: Download file for a replay content item.
get.description:
Downloads the replay file (if available).

Only applicable to content items with `type == "replay"`.

get.summary: Download iRacing setup for a setup content item.
get.description:
Downloads the iRacing setup file (if available).

Only applicable to content items with `type == "setup"`.

post.description: Create an invite to join a team.

delete.description: Removes a member from the team

get.summary: Get team driving statistics.
get.description:
Driving statistics for the members of the team.

Each returned record is a combination of car, track, day and driver.
You'll need to sum up these rows according to the specific numbers you
want to calculate (e.g. per car).

## Limitations

This method only returns information about teams that the authenticated
user is a member of.

The authenticated user will need to be a team owner if the team is
configured to only show statistics to team owners.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Select statistics starting at this date.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Select statistics ending at this date.

parameters.name: cars
parameters.description:
Car IDs to search for.

This can be a combination of car and car category IDs, where the
car category IDs are supplied as negative number.

For instance, to search for car 3 or category 4, use `cars=3,-4`.

get.summary: Available tracks.
get.description:
Tracks to which the user has access.

This is a personalized view and depends on the enabled platforms.

For simulator platforms such as iRacing, this returns all available
tracks, not just the ones that are owned by the user.

cars.description: IDs of the cars that are part of this group.

total.description: Total number of available car groups, across all pages.
Total number of available cars, across all pages.

maxUsages.description: Maximum number of times this invite can be used (0 = unlimited).

expiresAfter.description: Number of seconds before invite expires (0 = never).

sessionType.description:
Session type

Available values:

  * `1`: Practice
  * `2`: Qualifying
  * `3`: Race

code.description: Single word identifier for this error.

trace.description:
Trace ID, for debugging purposes.

Be sure to mention this ID if you are running into any problems.

driver.description:
Driver information.

Can be empty if the driver for a lap is unknown.

driverRating.description: Driver rating at the time of driving, if known.

event.description: Event ID in which the lap was driven.

sessionType.description:
Session type

Available values:

  * `1`: Practice
  * `2`: Qualifying
  * `3`: Race

lapNumber.description: Lap number, as assigned by race control.

clean.description: Is this a clean, complete lap?

discontinuity.description:
Whether this lap had a discontinuity, which is usually a gap
in the recording of telemetry.

missing.description: Is data for this lap missing?

incomplete.description:
Is this an incomplete lap?

A lap might be incomplete if a tow occured. A full complete lap
starts and ends at the start/finish line.

offtrack.description: Did the driver go off track during this lap?

pitlane.description: Did the car travel through pit lane on this lap?

pitIn.description: Did the car enter the pit lane on this lap?

pitOut.description: Did the car exit the pit lane on this lap?

trackUsage.description: Track usage, as a percentage (0 = clean track, 100 = fully rubbered in).

trackWetness.description: Track wetness, as a percentage (0 = dry, 100 = fully wet).

clouds.description:
Cloud cover.

Available values:

  * `1`: Clear skies
  * `2`: Partly cloudy
  * `3`: Mostly cloudy
  * `4`: Overcast

ghostAvailable.description: Is a ghost lap available for this lap?

canViewTelemetry.description: Can you view the telemetry data?

total.description: Total number of available laps, across all pages.

slug.description: User slug, which is the path of the driver profile.

apiPermissions.description: API permissions granted to the token used to make this request.

teams.description: Teams that the authenticated user is part of.

subscribedDataPacks.description:
Data packs to which this user is subscribed.

Contains the IDs of the data packs to which this user is directly
subscribed. Only those data packs that are part of the team owning
the application are returned.

Only available with the `datapacks_subscriptions` permission.

subscribedDataPackGroups.description:
Data pack groups to which this user is subscribed.

Contains the IDs of the data pack groups to which this user is
subscribed. Only those data pack groups that are part of the team
owning the application are returned.

Only available with the `datapacks_subscriptions` permission.

total.description: Total number of available platforms, across all pages.

slug.description: Team slug, which is the path of the team profile.

sku.description: SKU, if linked to an external integration

archived.description: True when the data pack is archived

replayDriver.description: User ID of the driver (if knonwn)

textBody.description: Text content, to be interpreted as Markdown.

dataPacks.description: Data packs which are added to this data pack group.

total.description: Total number of available data pack groups, across all pages.

archived.description: True when the data pack is archived

total.description: Total number of available data packs, across all pages.

slug.description: Team slug, which is the path of the team profile.

usages.description: Number of times this invite has been used

maxUsages.description: Maximum number of times this invite can be used (0 = unlimited).

slug.description: User slug, which is the path of the driver profile

total.description: Total number of joined teams, across all pages.

variant.description: Variant name (the layout of the track that was used)

total.description: Total number of available tracks, across all pages.

archived.description: Set to true to archive a data pack.

ratingDisplayAs.description: Formatted rating value for display purposes

history.description: Rating history, only present if the `ratingHistory` query parameter was supplied

ratingDisplayAs.description: Formatted rating value for display purposes

total.description: Total number of available accounts, across all pages.

slug.description: User slug, which is the path of the driver profile

scopes.driving_data: Access to driving data (personal and teammates)
